codeSystems.name: AllLanguages
codeSystems.title: All Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Body Structures
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 442083009 (Anatomical or acquired body site (body structure)).

codeSystems.name: DataAbsentReason
codeSystems.title: Data Absent Reason
codeSystems.description: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: LOINCCodes
codeSystems.title: LOINC Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all LOINC codes

codeSystems.name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Interpretation Codes
codeSystems.description:
A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.   
   
   Notes:
   
   This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.

codeSystems.name: ObservationMethods
codeSystems.title: Observation Methods
codeSystems.description: Observation Method codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 272394005 (Technique (qualifier value)) or is-a 129264002 (Action (qualifier value)) or is-a 386053000 (Evaluation procedure(procedure))

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeNormalValueCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Normal Value Codes
codeSystems.description: Codes that describe the normal value in the reference range, such as “Negative” or “Absent”

codeSystems.name: ObservationStatus
codeSystems.title: Observation Status
codeSystems.description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

codeSystems.name: TriggeredBytype
codeSystems.title: triggered Bytype
codeSystems.description: Codes providing the type of triggeredBy observation.

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeAppliesToCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Applies To Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the particular target population the reference range applies to.

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

codeSystems.name: EEBodyPositionVS
codeSystems.title: Body Position ValueSet
codeSystems.description: ValueSet for body positions during clinical measurements.

codeSystems.name: EEObservationCodeVS
codeSystems.title: Observation Code ValueSet
codeSystems.description: Locally defined codes used for clinical observation types in the project.
